intro: Ouratea umbricola, commonly known as the dark earth ouratea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in humid lowland forests. The plant is characterized by its dark green, leathery leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found growing in the understory of dense tropical vegetation. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
